description: Individual plants that are georeferenced, identified, measured, and/or sampled.

elements.description:
The study site within which the plant occurs.

Before creating a new site, ask co-workers if a site has been created on another device but not yet synced.

If not, create a new site record.
elements.label: Site

elements.description: The plot in which the plant occurs.
elements.label: Plot

elements.description: Plant selected for leaf spectroscopy and/or trait measurements, and/or collection of a pressed specimen.
Unique field ID for the plant. Defined automatically as the Unix timestamp (= number fo seconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00UTC) - 1519142458 (to obtain a smaller number).
elements.label: Plant ID

elements.description: Is the plant marked using a tag (e.g. aluminium tag, annotated flagging tape)?
elements.label: Plant Tagged?

elements.description: Comments or notes about the tag.
elements.label: Tag Remarks

elements.description: Photos showing parts of or the entire plant, and/or also its immediate surrounding environment.
elements.label: Plant Photos

elements.description: Close-up photos of plant showing characteristic features useful for taxonomic identification (e.g. flowers, fruits).
elements.label: Close-Up Photos

elements.description: Comments or notes about the plant.
elements.label: Plant Remarks
Plant

elements.description: A list of names of people responsible for recording the First Occurrence. The primary collector or observer, especially one who applies a personal identifier (Plant ID or Tag ID), should be listed first.
elements.label: First Observed By

elements.description: The date when the First Occurrence was recorded.
elements.label: Date First Observed

elements.description: Comments or notes about the First Occurrence.
elements.label: First Occurrence Remarks

elements.description: The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the EPSG:4326 / WGS84  spatial reference system) of the geographic center of the plot. Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.
elements.label: Latitude (degrees)

elements.description: The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the EPSG:4326 / WGS84 spatial reference system) of the geographic center of the plot. Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.
elements.label: Longitude (degrees)

elements.description:
The horizontal distance (in meters) from the given latitude and longitude describing the smallest circle containing the whole of the location of the plot center. Leave the value empty if the uncertainty is unknown, cannot be estimated, or is not applicable (because there are no coordinates).  Zero is not a valid value for this term.

NOTE: it is not clear how Fulcrum gets this value, and what it is. For a general discussion about location accuracy, see: http://www.navipedia.net/index.php/Accuracy.  Presumably Fulcrum takes it directly from the device GPS, although this might mean different things in Android or iOS.

In iOS, which metric of horizontal accuracy is used is not specified (see: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/corelocation/cllocation/1423599-horizontalaccuracy). They only say that it corresponds to "the radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters". This implies a 2D measure of horizontal accuracy.

Android provides a much clearer definition of horizontal accuracy (see https://developer.android.com/reference/android/location/Location.html#getAccuracy()): "We define horizontal accuracy as the radius of 68% confidence. In other words, if you draw a circle centered at this location's latitude and longitude, and with a radius equal to the accuracy, then there is a 68% probability that the true location is inside the circle".
elements.label: Horizontal Accuracy (m)

elements.description: The elevation in meters (m) above the ellipsoid defined by the EPSG:4326 / WGS84 spatial reference system. This is commonly referred to as the height in meters above mean sea level (AMSL).
elements.label: Altitude (m)

elements.description:
The vertical uncertainty associated with an altitude measurement, in meters (m). Leave the value empty if the uncertainty is unknown, cannot be estimated, or is not applicable (because there are no coordinates).  Zero is not a valid value for this term.

NOTE: it is not clear how Fulcrum gets this value, and what it is. For a general discussion about location accuracy, see: http://www.navipedia.net/index.php/Accuracy.  Presumably Fulcrum takes it directly from the device GPS, although this might mean different things in Android or iOS.

In iOS, which metric of vertical accuracy is used is not specified (see: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/corelocation/cllocation/1423550-verticalaccuracy). They only say that it corresponds to "the accuracy of the altitude value, measured in meters".

Android provides a much clearer definition of vertical accuracy (see https://developer.android.com/reference/android/location/Location.html#getVerticalAccuracyMeters()): "We define vertical accuracy at 68% confidence. Specifically, as 1-side of the 2-sided range above and below the estimated altitude, within which there is a 68% probability of finding the true altitude. In the case where the underlying distribution is assumed Gaussian normal, this would be considered 1 standard deviation. For example, if the estimated altitude is 150 m, and the vertical accuracy is 20 m then there is a 68% probability of the true altitude being between 130 and 170 m".
elements.label: Vertical Accuracy (m)

elements.description: The checklist used to provide the scientific name of the taxon.
elements.label: Taxon Checklist

elements.description: Filter the VASCAN database based on geographical distribution by selecting ONE region (e.g. Canadian province). Can be combined with growth form filter.
elements.label: VASCAN Filter: Geography

elements.description: Filter VASCAN database based by selecting ONE particular growth form. Can be combined with geography filter.
elements.label: VASCAN Filter: Growth Form

elements.description: A group of vascular plants considered by taxonomists to form a homogeneous unit, based on the VASCAN database.
elements.label: VASCAN Taxon

elements.description: A group of bryphoytes considered by taxonomists to form a homogeneous unit, based on the Bryoquel database.
elements.label: Bryoquel Taxon

elements.description: A group of organisms considered by taxonomists to form a homogeneous unit,  whose taxon is not available in VASCAN or other taxonomic checklists accessible within Fulcrum.
elements.label: Generic Taxon

elements.description: A list of names of people who assigned the Taxon to the subject. The primary identifier should be listed first.
elements.label: Identified By

elements.description: The date on which the subject was identified as representing the Taxon.
elements.label: Date Identified

elements.description: The name of the protocol used to determine the taxonomic identity.
elements.label: Identification Protocol

elements.description: The references (e.g. publication, online resource) used in the Identification.
elements.label: Identification Reference(s)

elements.description: A brief phrase or a standard term ("cf.", "aff.") to express the determiner's doubts about the Identification. For the determination "Quercus aff. agrifolia var. oxyadenia", identificationQualifier would be "aff. agrifolia var. oxyadenia" with accompanying values "Quercus" in genus, "agrifolia" in specificEpithet, "oxyadenia" in infraspecificEpithet, and "var." in rank. 2) For the determination "Quercus agrifolia cf. var. oxyadenia", identificationQualifier would be "cf. var. oxyadenia " with accompanying values "Quercus" in genus, "agrifolia" in specificEpithet, "oxyadenia" in infraspecificEpithet, and "var." in rank. In most cases only the lowest taxon is in doubt, but cases exist where good reasons exist to suspect a specific or even infraspecific determination, without having a safe generic identification.
elements.label: Identification Qualifier

elements.description: Comments or notes about the Identification.
elements.label: Identification Remarks

elements.description: Audio comments or notes about the Identification.
elements.label: Identification Audio Remarks

elements.description: The type of size measurement(s) performed on the plant.
elements.label: Measurement Type

elements.description: The diameter at breast height (= 1.3 m) for trees greater than 1.3 m tall.
elements.label: DBH (cm)

elements.description: Plant height (m).
elements.label: Height (m)

elements.description: The diameter (m) of the entire crown at its widest.
elements.label: Crown diameter (m)

elements.description: The leaf area index (LAI) of the plant.
elements.label: Leaf Area Index

elements.description: A list of names of people,responsible for recording the size measurement(s). The primary observer should be listed first.
elements.label: Measured By

elements.description: The date on which the plant was measured.
elements.label: Date Measured

elements.description:
DO NOT DELETE !
ITS USED IN FUNCTIONS
elements.label: Size Measurements ID

name: Plants

status_field.description: Status of record. Record first requires verification. Once verified, it can be submitted for approval; this locks the record for standard users. If approved, the record eventually gets published. If rejected, it goes back to standard users for further verification.
status_field.label: Record Status
